didYouKnow.title: The Science Your Cat Doesn't Care About (But Your Nose Will)
didYouKnow.body:
A single gram of activated carbon contains roughly 3,000 square meters of surface area. That's bigger than half a football field — in something smaller than a pea.

Inside are millions of microscopic pores and tunnels. When ammonia molecules float past, they get trapped permanently.

This isn't masking. It's molecular capture. The same technology used in gas masks, water treatment plants, and hospital air filtration. Now sitting on top of your cat's litter.
